conbody.p: Phonex is a regular, pattern matching language for IPA transcriptions. It was developed for the Phon application as a method of searching for sequences of phones using termonology familiar with liguists; specifically though the use of phonetic features and syllable constituent types.

This document is a reference to version 2.0 of the phonex language. The following sections outline the various constructs and plug-ins provided with the language. The final sections detail how phonex can be used with the JavaTM programming language and how to extend phonex using custom plug-ins.
